body_html:
There are a lot of warnings about code page issues. For example:

C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0\include\cuda_runtime.h : warning C4819: The file contains a character that cannot be represented in the current code page (950). Save the file in Unicode format to prevent data loss (compiling source file D:\projects\tensorflow\tensorflow\core\kernels\slice_op.cc) [D:\projects\tensorflow\tensorflow\contrib\cmake\build\tf_core_kernels.vcxproj]

I'm not sure how the system code page interacts with the Visual C++ compiler—and there's no indication in the error message about exactly what character is causing problems—but it seems like it might be necessary to change your system settings to get this to build cleanly.

body:
There are a lot of warnings about code page issues. For example:

>  C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0\include\cuda_runtime.h : warning C4819: The file contains a character that cannot be represented in the current code page (950). Save the file in Unicode format to prevent data loss (compiling source file D:\projects\tensorflow\tensorflow\core\kernels\slice_op.cc) [D:\projects\tensorflow\tensorflow\contrib\cmake\build\tf_core_kernels.vcxproj]

I'm not sure how the system code page interacts with the Visual C++ compiler—and there's no indication in the error message about exactly what character is causing problems—but it seems like it might be necessary to change your system settings to get this to build cleanly.
